channel.title: ADD_ONION via Control Port (onion-grater)
channel.description:
I'd like to use the ADD_ONION command on Whonix-Workstation. Can someone please write the onion-grater configuration rule that would allow that? Thanks in advance!
Are there any security concerns for the ADD_ONION? I'm only interested in adding an ephemeral service that would last for only a couple of days.
I saw in the Docs that there's a 128 character limitation for commands. As ADD_ONION requires the whole private key to be submitted, 128 chars would not be sufficient. It says it's configurable, but I can't see that. Thanks!

item.title: ADD_ONION via Control Port (onion-grater)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
abc via Whonix Forum:

I’d like to use the ADD_ONION command on Whonix-Workstation. Can someone please write the onion-grater configuration rule that would allow that?

There are many examples using ADD_ONION here:

https://github.com/Whonix/onion-grater/tree/master/usr/share/doc/onion-grater-merger/examples

Tails might have other onion-grater profiles which could be useful for
inspiration.

Are there any security concerns for the ADD_ONION?

There’s a write-up about onion-grater security, see:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Template:Onion-grater-warning

And on onion services security, this:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Onion_Services#Onion_Services_Security

I saw in the Docs that there’s a 128 character limitation for commands.

That is likely outdated since ADD_ONION is fully functional.

Read full topic
